        • The maximum speed at master level has been increased from 15 to 20.
      • Dragon Vein Traces
        • The maximum amount of Earthly Energy that can be stored has been increased from 3 to 4.
      • Vine Coil
        • The skill is now usable while in the air.
      • Big Stretch
        • The maximum number of Dragon Veins that can be awakened has been decreased from 5 to 4.
        • The damage at Lv. 25 has been increased from 1200% to 2200%.
      • Land’s Connection
        • The shock damage at Lv. 25 has been increased from 1680% to 2100%.
        • The explosion damage at Lv. 25 has been increased from 2040% to 2800%.
      • Surging Essence
        • The damage at Lv. 25 has been increased from 1370% to 1700%.
      • Winding Mountain Ridge
        • The damage at Lv. 25 has been increased from 600% to 1000%.
      • HEXA Dragon Vein Eruption
        • The final damage of Absorption skill at master level has been increased from 20% to 21%.
      • HEXA Eruption: Heaving River
        • The Weak Heaving River damage at master level has been increased from 1050% to 1110%.
        • The Big Surge damage at master level has been increased from 1220% to 1320%.
      • HEXA Eruption: Whirlwind
        • The damage at master level has been increased from 628% to 690%.
      • HEXA Eruption: Sunrise Well
        • The damage when giant surges at master level has been increased from 1048% to 1060%.
        • The damage in the lava region at master level has been increased from 570% to 600%.
        • The damage of Volcanic Bombs at master level has been increased from 668% to 675%.
    • Hoyoung
      • Graceful Flight
        • The ability to jump upwards has been added.
      • Nimbus Cloud
        • A feature that reduces flight time when used after Graceful Flight in the upward direction has been added.
        • You will not be able to use Graceful Flight in the upward direction after using this skill.
      • Light Steps
        • The speed has been increased from 20 to 22.
      • Fortune Fitness
        • A feature that permanently increases Final Damage has been added.
      • Talisman: Seeking Ghost Flame
        • The duration has been increased from 40 seconds to 90 seconds.
      • Shura
        • A feature that permanently increases Final Damage has been added.
      • Sage: Tai Yu’s Miracle Tonic
        • A feature that prevents the consumption of Talisman Energy or Scroll Energy for a certain period of time has been added.
      • Sage: Dream of Shangri-La
        • The skill description has been changed.
      • The following skills are now usable while in the air:
        • Sage: Clone Rampage
        • Sage: Wrath of Gods

    Back to Top

    Level-up Flow Changes

    • A new ‘Main’ quests category has been added, featuring a distinct UI indicator to show that the quest belongs to the main category.

    • The amount of EXP obtained from Main Quests under Lv. 200 has been adjusted.
      • Main Quests include: Riena Strait, Verne Mine, Join the Alliance, Azwan, Heliseum, Lion King’s Castle, Root Abyss, The Alliance Gathers, Temple of Time, Silent Crusade, Stone Colossus, Henesys Ruins, Kritias, Twilight Perion, Haven, Dark World Tree, Silent Crusade 2
    • Quest EXP from Lv. 30 - 59 Special Theme Dungeons will be given regardless of character level.
      • Special Theme Dungeons include: Riena Strait, Ellinel Fairy Academy, Gold Beach Resort, Secret Forest of Elodin.
    • Quest-related UI has been updated.
      • An additional category tab has been added to the quest UI.
      • A separate quest bubble will be used for Job/Main Quests.
      • A separate quest tag will be used in front of quest names for Job/Main Quests.
      • NPCs that can complete Job/Main Quests will now blink on the mini-map.
      • Unchecked Job/Main Quests within the lightbulb notifier have an additional lightbulb image to make them more visible.
    • Maple Guide UI Revamp
      • ‘Level Content’ will change to match the main quest revamp.
      • All hunting zones for each level in ‘Level Content’ have been changed to be more visible.
      • Quest notification buttons have been added to the minimized Maple Guide UI.
    • Some quest dialogue and effects related to Riena Strait have been changed.
    • Verne Mine region quests have been revamped.
    • Alliance quests have been revamped.
    • Azwan region quests have been revamped.
    • Some Magatia region quests have been revamped.
      • Level requirement for all quests has been changed to Lv. 85.
      • All quest completion conditions have been lowered.
      • Auto - movement to quest region, navigation, and other convenient functions have been added.
    • Added convenient functions to Heliseum quests.
    • Lion King’s Castle quests have been revamped.
    • Some quests related to Root Abyss have been revamped.
      • Some Root Abyss quests have been deleted.
    • Some Temple of Time region quests have been revamped.
      • Level requirement for all quests has been changed to Lv. 130.
      • All quest completion conditions have been lowered.
    • Some Stone Colossus quests have been revamped.
    • Some Kritias region quests have been revamped.
      • All quest completion conditions have been lowered.
      • Auto movement to quest region, navigation, and other convenient functions have been added.
    • The level requirement for Twilight Perion region quests have been changed to Lv. 185.
    • Summaries for Black Heaven and Heroes of Maple have been added.
    • The level requirement for Black Heaven and Heroes of Maple have been changed to Lv. 190.
    • ‘Silent Crusade 2’ quests have been added.

    Back to Top

    Intense Power Crystal Revamp

    • Intense Power Crystals are now divided into daily, weekly, and monthly crystals.
      • Note: Intense Power Crystals obtained before maintenance on November 20 will be sold at the pre-maintenance price.
    • Check the number of daily, weekly, and monthly Intense Power Crystals sold through the dialogue above the Collector. Sales records reset every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • Use the “Sell All” button to sell all crystals. After reaching the weekly crystal limit, only daily and monthly crystals will be sold.
      • A maximum of 12 weekly crystals can be sold per character.

    Note: If a weekly crystal of higher value compared to your previous crystal is sold, you’ll receive the difference in mesos without affecting the world limit.

    Back to Top

    Familiars: Hotel Arcus

    • The following Hotel Arcus monsters will now drop Familiar cards:
    Monster Name Image
    Sandblade Marauder
    Ironshot Desperado
    Puxillian Rover
    Puxillian Scrounger
    Conductorbot
    Houndbot
    • A new badge has been added to the Familiar Badge List for obtaining all Hotel Arcus Familiars.
      • Wasteland Badge: Magic ATT +1% and Ignore Defense +3%.

    Back to Top

    Boss/Monster Changes and Bug Fixes

    Boss Improvements

    • Items will no longer be dropped on platforms that can’t be used in the Epic Dungeon: High Mountain boss battle map.
    • The Gnarled Wooden Key item will no longer be needed to enter the Root Abyss boss battles.
      • Blazing Imp, Pointy Imp, Elite Blazing Imp, and Elite Pointy Imp enemies will no longer drop the Gnarled Wooden Key item.
      • NPC Havis will no longer show up at the Colossal Root.
    • You no longer need 5 Normal Mode clears to enter the Chaos versions of the Root Abyss bosses: Pierre, Von Bon, Crimson Queen, and Vellum.
    • You can now move between boss entry maps by using the Boss UI/Maple Planner.
    • Boss battle cutscene ‘Skip’ functionality has been added for the following bosses:
      • Akechi, Lotus, Damien, Lucid, Guardian Angel Slime, Will, Versus Hilla, Black Mage, Seren, Kalos, and Kaling.
      • Cutscene will skip if the party leader presses the ESC key during the boss cutscene.
        • If the party leader has disconnected or logged off, another party member will be appointed to use the ‘skip’ function.
    • A special effect will play when the following reward items are dropped:
      • Damaged Black Heart
      • Berserked
      • Total Control
      • Magic Eyepatch
      • Dreamy Belt
      • Cursed Spellbook Coupon
      • Endless Terror
      • Commanding Force Earring
      • Source of Suffering
      • Genesis Badge
      • Mitra's Rage Coupon
      • Exceptional Hammer (Belt)
      • Exceptional Hammer (Face Accessory)
      • Exceptional Hammer (Eye Accessory)
      • Exceptional Hammer (Earrings)
      • Whisper of the Source
      • White Jade Boss Ring Box (Exceptional)
      • Grindstone of Life

    Boss Reward Changes

    • Added new boss battle rewards:
      • Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme)
        • Small Concentrated EXP Accumulation Potion: Tradable, Permanent.
      • Kalos the Guardian (Chaos, Extreme)
        • Divine Eternal Armor Box: Untradable, 7-day duration. Open to choose one of the following:
          • Eternal Hat: Tradable, Permanent.
          • Eternal Top: Tradable, Permanent.
          • Eternal Bottom: Tradable, Permanent.
        • Small Concentrated EXP Accumulation Potion: Tradable, Permanent.
      • Kaling (Hard, Extreme)
        • Ferocious Beast Eternal Armor Box: Untradable, 7-day duration. Open to choose one of the following:
          • Eternal Top, Bottom, or Shoulder Accessory: Untradable, Permanent.
        • Small Concentrated EXP Accumulation Potion: Tradable, Permanent.
    • Items drop at a set probability and are unaffected by item drop rate increase stat.
    • The drop rate of items changes based on the boss difficulty.
    • The following boss battle rewards have been removed:
      • Chosen Seren (Hard, Extreme)
        • Primal Essence
        • Small EXP Accumulation Potion
        • Small Condensed EXP Accumulation Potion Recipe
      • Kalos the Guardian (Chaos, Extreme)
        • Primal Essence
        • Small EXP Accumulation Potion
        • Small Condensed EXP Accumulation Potion Recipe
      • Kaling (Hard, Extreme)
        • Primal Essence
        • Small EXP Accumulation Potion
        • Small Condensed EXP Accumulation Potion Recipe
    • Revamped Lotus will be summoned on floor 70 of Mu Lung Dojo.
    • Will’s hitbox has been increased when in the groggy state during phase 2 boss battle.
    • All boss reward monsters are able to be hit by skills as well as normal attacks.
      • Affected bosses: Pierre, Crimson Queen, Black Mage, Chosen Seren
    • The safe zone range of Seren’s phase 2 Authority pattern has been increased.

    Boss/Monster Bug Fixes

    • Resolved an issue where Qiongqi was not being taunted by certain summons during phase 1 of Kaling boss battle.
    • Resolved an issue where Hankie’s monster sound effects were not playing in the Mirror World.
    • Resolved an issue where the player would sometimes get hit after landing a stun skill on a charging enemy.
    • Resolved an issue causing debuff effects to show incorrectly during some enemies’ teleport patterns.
    • Resolved an issue where ‘Aspect of Pestilence’ was not being affected by slows during the Epic Dungeon: High Mountain 3 stage.
    • Resolved an issue where players would be moved immediately to the next field after defeating Lotus.
    • Resolved an issue causing animations to show incorrectly when hit by a stun skill during Lotus phase 2 boss battle.
    • Resolved an issue where Verus Hilla’s HP would be abnormally low in the Story difficulty.
    • Resolved an issue causing players to fly in the opposite direction when hit by the Shadow Grab during Kaling phase 3 boss battle.
    • Resolved an issue where the Black Crescendo Slime would grow one level and remain permanently if not defeated within the time limit.

    Back to Top

    Monster Park Changes

    • Monster Park entry-exclusive UI added
    • The dungeon clear EXP for Monster Park Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced has been doubled.
    • Additional entry tickets for the Monster Park sold from the Cash Shop will be adjusted.
    • The amount of clears for Monster Park Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced dungeons have been changed.
      • Daily free clear count has been changed to 1.
      • Daily additional clear count has been changed to 6.
    • Starting from November 20th, the amount of Monster Park Free Entry Tickets obtained from the MVP Gift Pack Rewards has been changed.
    MVP Rank Park Free Entry Ticket Distribution
    Silver 2
    Gold 3
    Diamond 7
    Red 10

    Back to Top

    NPC Changes and Bug Fixes

    NPC Changes

    • You can now immediately rechallenge the Flag Race after talking to Programmer Simon at the exit map.

    NPC Bug Fixes

    • Fixed the issue causing the Yggdrasil Rune and Chaos Yggdrasil Rune to be invisible while in NPC Oko’s shop.
    • Fixed the issue where Monster Park Commemorative Coins would be invisible while in NPC Laku’s Shop.
    • Fixed the issue where NPC Bavan would disappear after completing the Black Heaven quest.
    • Fixed the issue of NPC Dostov not being visible on the world map.
    • Fixed the issue where the lines of NPC Edelstein Taxi would not change after completing Black Heaven content.
    • Fixed the issue where the NPC Jenn at Spiegelmann’s Guest House would not appear after the Jenn’s Brother quest was completed.
    • Fixed the issue where the NPC Dostov, located in Kritias, was not marked on the world map.
    • Fixed the issue where Young Ifia's dialogue window displayed awkwardly.
    • Changed the appearance of NPC Lotus' in the Labyrinth of Suffering.

    Back to Top

    UI Changes and Bug Fixes

    UI Changes

    • Added a Pet/Android transparency adjustment feature.
      • You are able to adjust the transparency for the pets/androids.
    • Changed text for the Burning Character selection button in the Character Selection Screen.
    • The background of the Character Info UI has been expanded horizontally.
    • Skill Macro UI
      • You are able to remove skills from the skill macro UI by right-clicking.
      • When placing a skill over another skill that already exists, the new skill will swap places with the other.
    • Event List UI
      • Revamped the Event UI to display a list of events currently in progress.
    • When using a skill, only skills that have an icon that appears in the buff display area at the top right of the screen can now be added to your Favorites. If there are any skills that can’t be registered as a favorite after the update, they are automatically removed from the Favorites List upon logging in.
    • Exchanged items can no longer interact with owned items.
    • Crafting Process UI can now be closed with the ESC key.
    • When players are unable to make requests to join a guild, the status will be clearly notified to the players.
    • The avatar info of your current character will be applied immediately when opening the Fast Character Change UI and Legion UI.
    • The ‘Select All’ button in the V Matrix Disassembly mode UI has been divided.
      • Changed to ‘Select All Pages’ and ‘Select Current Page’.
    • Item Auto-Storage option has been added to the bag UI.
      • Checked items will be stored within the bag first.
      • Unchecked items will be stored within the inventory first.
    • Changed a portion of the Potential Ability UI.
      • A sparkling effect will be show in the increased rank when a Potential Ability’s rank has been enhanced.
    • The warning text that displays when players select ‘BEFORE’ after enhancing a Potential Ability and can no longer be controlled with the Enter Key.
    • If there are normal quests that can be completed, players will be guided to the event NPC speech bubble before main/job quests that are in progress or can be started.
    • Any enhancement items that were in use will be cancelled when trying to exchange items.
    • The guide text has been made more natural when trying to register game items during a ‘Cash Item Trade’.
    • When Maple Guide UI is minimized, the last position will be saved.
    • Character Selection Screen Changes
      • A Job Level-Up Status UI has been added to allow you to check your progression status by job.
        • Sorted by level in descending order, and displays jobs that have not been leveled yet.
        • When you hover your mouse over a job you have, your character name will be displayed, and you can click on it to select the character.
      • Character information UI has been revamp with new design improvements.
        • Stats basic value guide has been removed.
        • Combat Power guide has been added.
      • Character Slot UI will always be displayed.
      • Character Selection screen page button has been moved for easier usability.
      • Character Selection screen page has been improved to allow the use of the mouse wheel.
      • Character creation window job list has been improved to allow the use of the mouse wheel.

    UI Bug Fixes

    • Fixed the issue that caused items to appear incorrectly when clicking the ‘Consolidate’ button within the inventory.
    • Fixed the issue where the Maple News UI content was not displaying items as intended.
    • Fixed the issue causing extractions of scrolls and recipes to need more empty inventory spaces than needed.
    • Fixed the issue causing the incorrect Job Advancement count to be shown when job advancing into a Dual Blade.
    • Fixed the issue causing the notification window for friend invitations and guild invitations to disappear when changing the screen resolution.
    • Fixed the issue causing the player to be unable to close the bag when the Trophy Display Case chair is in the Chair Bag.
    • Fixed the issue where the Cursed Rune effect was displayed on other characters’ information windows.
    • Fixed the issue where Zero’s Beta was unable to use the second ring slot by double-clicking when using the lower ring slot within the Outfit Preset.
    • Fixed the issue where Hyper Stats Remaining Points were being displayed incorrectly.
    • Fixed the issue where the system message was displaying incorrectly for the Golden Hammer and Soul item tooltips.
    • Fixed the issue causing Piece of Memory and Shard of Recollection to not drop in the Temple of Time’s Star Force map.
    • Fixed the issue causing ‘Insufficient Cash Balance’ pop-up to display after failing to make a purchase from the Maple Reward Shop with Reward Points.
    • Fixed the issue causing the level of the Nodes within the HEXA Matrix Stat UI to display incorrectly.
    • Resolved issue where the image in Epic Dungeon entry UI was misaligned when hovering over.
    • Fixed the issue where the display of the skin slot in the Equipment UI looked awkward.
    • Fixed the issue where the cursed rune effect on a player would be visible in another character's info window.

    Back to Top

    Maple Planner

    • A brand-new feature is here to help you PLAN your time and make sure you won't miss completing another task!


    • This new feature allows players to check the progress of repeatable content after a quick peek.
      • You can start and claim ALL Daily Quests and Weekly Quests within the Maple Planner.
      • You can also track daily, weekly and monthly boss progress as well.

    Back to Top

    V Matrix Improvements

    • The starting number of equippable Node slots at Lv. 200 has been increased from 7 slots to 12 slots.
    • The maximum number of equippable Node slots has been increased from 25 slots to 30 slots.
    • After maintenance on November 20, players who previously used mesos to expand their Node slots will retain those expansions.

    • A feature to craft custom Boost Nodes has been added.
      • While in the Nodecrafting UI, click “Craft Custom Boost Node” to open the Craft Custom Boost Node UI.
      • Select the Boost Node in the desired order for the three slots.
      • 500 Node Shards are required to craft a custom Boost Node.

    • A feature to extend the Special Node duration has been added.
      • Right-click on an expired Special Node and use Node Shards to extend the duration by 30 days.
    • Unexpired Special Nodes can also be extended and the amount of Nodes consumed is determined by the extension period.

    • Usable Special Nodes can also have their duration extended and the required Node Shards will be based on the remaining duration.
    • When equipping a new Special Node in a slot with an existing Node, dragging the new Node to any slot will automatically replace the current one.
    • A notice for Nodes that lose EXP due to exceeding the max enhancement rank when using the "Enhance All" button has been added.

    Back to Top

    Buff Display Settings System

    • A system to configure buff display settings has been added.
      • The Buff Display Settings can be accessed through Settings - Options in the UI tab.
    • A UI tab will be added to Settings - Options.
      • The previous UI category from the Graphics tab and the Enter category from the Game tab have been moved to their own UI tabs.
      • A Buff Display Settings category has been added.

    • Buffs displayed in the top-right of the screen can be customized by using the Buff Auto-Sort and Minimize features.
      • Auto-sorted buffs will be displayed in the following order:
        • Skill buffs from your Job
        • Common skill buffs
        • Item buffs
        • Skill buffs from other Jobs

      • The Minimize Buffs feature allows you to hide specific rows of buffs as needed.

    • The Buff Favorites feature allows selected buffs to appear in a separate draggable UI panel, instead of displaying at the top-right of the screen.
      • Click “Buff Favorites Settings” in Options to customize the layout with up to 10 rows and 10 slots.
      • Enable or disable the Buff Favorites feature in the Options UI.
      • Skills learned by the character can all be added to Favorites, except for skills like Guild Skills, Mount Skills, and Event Skills.

    Back to Top

    Damage Skin UI Changes

    • The damage Skin UI size has been expanded.
    • Players are able to freely change the location of each damage skin.
      • The Consolidate button will sort skins to the top.
    • Amount of current slots and spaces will be shown on the bottom of the UI.
      • If you hover over the slot number it will show you how many additional slots can be expanded.

    Back to Top

    Item Changes and Bug Fixes

    Item Changes

    • A warning message will be displayed if the Monster Collection is full when using a Mysterious Monsterbloom.
    • Hyper Burning characters are able to use Typhoon Growth Potions, Magnificent Growth Potions, and Transcendent Growth Potions.
      • Note: this improvement only applies to items obtained after the maintenance on November 20.
    • Clarity changes to differentiate EXP Coupon items have been made for 1.5 EXP Coupon and 3x EXP Coupon icons.
    • Soul Enchanter and Soul items can be used by double-clicking.
    • The following buffs will no longer be removed upon exiting the game:
      • Legion’s Luck Lv. 1-3
      • Legion’s Wealth Lv. 1-3
    • Androids item slots have been expanded to include the following:
      • Weapon
      • Eye Accessory
      • Earrings
      • Rings
    • Android weapon motions will be applied as one-handed weapon motions.
      • Two-handed weapons will not be equipped
    • Android Hair, Face, and skin information will be visible within the Android Equipment UI.
    • Maximum item drop rate has been increased.
    • When using a Boss Ring Box in a party, the ring box item used and item obtained will be displayed to all party members.
    • Secondary weapon merchant Nevel now sells Lv. 100 emblems for each job.
      • Emblems for each job (except for Kaiser, Angelic Buster, and Xenon) can be purchased after completing the respective emblem quest.
      • Zero is able to purchase an emblem after completing the Alpha and Omega quest.

    Item Bug Fixes

    • Fixed the issue where the Shadow Night Cape would be animated weirdly after equipping a two-handed weapon.
    • Fixed the issue causing sound effects to not work after using the Soul Enchanter or Soul item on weapons.
    • Fixed the issue causing a chat bubble from Lil Aran, Lil Phantom, and Lil Evan pets to display incorrectly.
    • Fixed the issue of the icon images showing incorrectly for the Clockwork Knight Chat Ring Coupon and Clockwork Knight Chat Ring.
    • Fixed the issue where the text for the Advanced Hunter Pouch included a Chaos Scroll 100%, despite that item being unobtainable.

    Back to Top

    Quest Changes and Bug Fixes

    Genesis Weapon Quest Changes

    • Genesis Weapon Quest UI added.
      • After accepting ‘[Genesis Weapon] After the Destined Battle’ quest you can gain access to the Genesis Weapon Quest UI on the left of the screen.
      • You are able to click the ‘View Previous Records’ button to view past records.
    • After completion of each quest it will ask you to proceed to the next quest right away.
    • When attempting awakening missions, an image for the mission will be displayed on the bottom of the timer.
    • The ‘Obtain Black Mage Remnant’ completion condition has been changed to ‘Defeat the Genesis Crux’.
      • Characters who were in the progress of the awakening missions and already own the Black Mage Remnant will have the item deleted from their inventory and it will count as if they’ve already defeated the Genesis Crux.
    • The Lucid Awakening mission has been changed to ‘Defeat using only Usable Item x50’.

    Quest Changes

    • 6th Job Advancement Quest Revamped
      • The Amount of EXP required to fill the Stones has decreased from 50 billion to 10 billion EXP.
      • ‘The Goddess Inside Erda (2)’ and ‘The Goddess Inside Erda (3)’ quests can now be completed without filling the Arcane Stone.
      • The amount of EXP needed to fill the Arcane Stones will be adjusted even if the player is currently in progress of the quest.
    • Root Abyss daily quests will no longer be available.
    • Arcane River daily quests will be available once the region story quest is fully completed.
    • The following Arcane River daily guide quests will no longer be available:
      • [Daily Quest] Temple of Time Research Expedition
      • [Daily Quest] The Mad Chef
      • [Daily Quest] Gray Mask’s Request
      • [Daily Quest] The Tree Spirits’ Request
      • [Esfera] Ollie’s Message
      • [Daily Quest] Tenebris Research Group
    • The following Haven weekly quests will no longer be available:
      • [Weekly Quest] Scrapyard Special Request: Defense
      • [Weekly Quest] Skyline Special Request: Defense
      • [Weekly Quest] Black Heaven Deck Special Request: Defense
      • [Weekly Quest] Black Heaven Inside Special Request: Defense
    • The reward for ‘[Weekly Quest] Request Reward’ has been changed from Diffusion-Line Energy Core (Grade A) x12 to x20.
    • The image of Athena Pierce that appears in Henesys Ruins has been updated.

    Quest Bug Fixes

    • Fixed the issue causing players to not be able to progress in the Genesis Weapon Awakening Missions due to an equipped saddle item.
    • Fixed the issue causing players to not be able to enter the Erda Spectrum due to not being able to progress in the ‘[Vanishing Journey] Investigation Findings 1’ quest.

    Back to Top

    Map Changes and Bug Fixes

    Map Changes

    • Increased the size of Secret Record Reclamation (Battle Map).
    • NPC Mary will no longer reside in the Monster Park map.
    • The Trueffet Outskirts quest map will no longer be shared with other players.
    • Hidden recipes will no longer appear during Hungry Muto.
    • ‘Follow’ will no longer be shown in boss battle maps.
    • Improved access to Cernium Rocky Overlook Entrance from the Outpost.

    Map Bug Fixes

    • Fixed the issue with the number of monsters within Calm Beach 1.
    • Fixed the issue where players were unable to see each other’s characters within the following maps:
      • Peculiar Foggy Forest, Peculiar 100-Year-Old Herb Garden, Peculiar Temple Entrance, Peculiar Collapsed Temple, Peculiar Sahel.
    • Fixed the issue causing the background of Specter Mine Zone to display incorrectly.
    • Fixed the issue causing players to exit the quest map when you close the game during the ‘Black Wings on the Move’ quest.
    • Fixed the issue of players falling from the platform during the ‘High Mountain Stage 8’ High Mountain Ruins map.
    • Fixed the issue causing players to not see the Knight NPC in ‘some town in the El Nath Mountains’.
    • Fixed the issue where the background music during the Hilla boss Story difficulty would play incorrectly.
    • Fixed the issue where the left platform of the First Square map was visually cut off.
    • Fixed the issue where some maps were displayed incorrectly during the Shade character creation.
    • Fixed the issue where sometimes the Dragon egg would not exist at the top floor of the Bounty Hunter ‘Steal the Dragon Egg’ mini-game.
    • Fixed the issue causing the Elite Champion Dark Wolf to not appear in some Carcion maps.

    Back to Top

    Guild Castle Revamp

    • Guild Castle Weekly Reset Day Change
      • Guild Castle Weekly content will now reset every Thursday at 12:00 AM UTC.
      • Weekly Content affected:
        • Weekly Mission Completion Status and Enemy Quantity Reset
        • Weekly Mission Completion Count
        • Energy Level Reset and Recalculation
        • Guild Castle Common Research Remaining Time Decrease
        • Weekly Mission Reward
        • Breath of the Artisan status
    • Guild Castle Revamp: Weekly Mission Enhancement
      • Quantity for item distribution has been increased.
      • Weekly Additional Default Distribution items:

    Back to Top

    Exceptional Enhancement Changes

    • Names for the following Exceptional Parts have been changed:
    Updated Exceptional Enhancement Item Names
    Old Item Name New Item Name
    Nightmare Fragment Exceptional Hammer (Belt)
    Gravity Module Exceptional Hammer (Face Accessory)
    Mark of Destruction Exceptional Hammer (Eye Accessory)
    Helmet of Loyalty Exceptional Hammer (Earrings)
    • The Exceptional Enhancement UI can now be opened when using Exceptional Hammer or speaking with Wandering Blacksmith in any major town (Henesys, Nameless Town, and Cernium Square).

    • Pitched Boss equipment can be enhanced with an Exceptional Hammer once.
    • Brilliant Boss equipment can be enhanced with an Exceptional Hammer up to 3 times.
    • The first Exceptional Enhancement on any piece of equipment is guaranteed to succeed.
      • Subsequent enhancements may fail - utilize additional Exception Hammers and mesos to improve your chances of successful enhancements.
    • Added a feature that allows for the extraction of Exceptional Hammers using mesos.
      • Exceptional Hammer extraction has a 100% chance of success.
      • During extraction, the Exceptional Enhancement count on the equipment will decrease by one and you will obtain an Exceptional Hammer corresponding to the equipment.

    Back to Top

    Epic Dungeon Changes and Bug Fixes

    • Epic Dungeon Express Pass
      • You can spend 10,000 Maple points to immediately complete Epic Dungeon: High Mountain from the Epic Dungeon entry UI
      • You will receive the base rewards immediately and you can obtain bonus rewards from the Epic Dungeon entry UI afterwards.
      • Only Characters who have completed the Epic Dungeon: High Mountain at least once are able to use the Epic Dungeon Express Pass.
    • Adjusted the Difficulty of some Epic Dungeon: High Mountain stages.
      • The Atmospheric Effect and interaction guide related to Mitra’s Power Fragment have been added.
      • The multi-hit count to activate Mitra’s Power Fragment in stages 3,6,9, and 10 has been reduced from 9 to 6.
      • The charge damage from the boss in stage 3 has been decreased from 30% of max HP to 25%.
      • The damage from the boss’ poison effect in stage 3 has been decreased from 5% of max HP to 1%.
      • The stage 6 boss’ Pollutive Explosion damage has been decreased from 30% of max HP to 10%.
      • The Polluted Area damage in stage 6 has been reduced from 30% of max HP to 20%.
    • Improved stage transition when starting each stage within the Epic Dungeon.
    • Bonus Reward Revamp
      • Current bonus rewards and special bonus rewards will be replaced with EXP Bonus and Sol Erda Bonus.
        • Bonus rewards have two stages for each bonus respectively
    EXP Bonus Rewards by Stage
    Stage Additional Reward Maple Points Used
    1
    • 4x the Base Reward
    • Bonus EXP
    • Sol Erda Fragment x20
    		 7,500
    2
    • 8x the Base Reward
    • Bonus EXP
    • Sol Erda Fragment x40
    		 30,000
    Sol Erda Bonus Rewards by Stage
    Stage Additional Reward Maple Points Used
    1
    • Sol Erda x4
    • Sol Erda Fragment x20
    		 7,500
    2
    • Sol Erda x8
    • Sol Erda Fragment x40
    		 30,000

    Back to Top

    Fog Forest Training Grounds Changes

    • You are able to use buff effects without restriction and need of the skills or potions within the Fog Forest Training Grounds.
    • Buff effects are the same as ones listed within Boss Practice Mode exclusive buff function.
    • Selected buffs only apply within the Fog Forest Training Grounds and are removed upon exiting.
      • Previously applied buffs will also be removed upon using the Fog Forest Training Grounds’ exclusive buff function.

    Back to Top

    Collector’s Request

    November 20 (after maintenance)

    Requirement: Lv. 200 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    Have you heard of the Legendary Hero Sayram? Do whatever it takes to track Sayram’s path and bring back relics to purchase new items!

    • Accept the ‘[Collector’s Request] In Search of the Legend’ quest to talk to the Collector and start the story quest and learn more about the legendary warrior, Sayram.
    • Complete the story quest to purchase Sayram’s Elixer and Aurelia’s Elixer from the collector for 2,000,000 mesos.
      • Sayram’s Elixir: Untradable, 10-day duration.
        • Use Sayram’s Elixir to receive the following stats for 15 minutes: Max HP & MP +1750, Attack Power & Magic ATT +10%, Attack Power & Magic ATT +50, Boss Damage +10%, Critical Damage +16%, Critical Rate +20%.
        • The following buffs cannot be stacked with Sayram’s Elixir:
          • Call of the Wild
          • Sharp Eyes
          • Decent Sharp Eyes
          • Bless
          • Advanced Blessing
          • Decent Advanced Blessing
      • Aurelia’s Elixir: Untradable, 10-day duration.
        • Use Aurelia’s Elixir to receive a buff that ignores a fatal attack once.
        • The following buffs cannot be stacked with Aurelia’s Elixir:
          • Pantheon
          • Heaven’s Door
          • Lotus Flower
    • Upon completing the quest, other Lv. 200+ characters can purchase from the Collector without having to do the quest again.

    Note: Sayram’s Elixir and Aurelia’s Elixir cannot be used after entering a boss map, in Mu Lung Dojo, and in the Sharenian Culvert.

    Back to Top

    THE DARK RIDE: RIDE OR DIE EVENT

    The Dark Ride: Ride or Die

    November 20 (after maintenance) - February 11 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 200 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    Althea, an inspector of parallel worlds, calls upon you to investigate the schemes of the dastardly villain Kazax!

    • Click ‘[Ride Or Die] Mysterious Contact’ then ‘Participate’ within the star event notifier on the left side of the screen.
    • Upon accepting the quest, you will get teleported to the event map to meet Althea, someone who’s part of an organization that investigates multiversal anomalies between parallel worlds!
    • Face off against up to 6 bosses each week. Choose your difficulty level and how many challenges you want to take on.
    • There are three difficulties, once you choose your difficulty, the boss you will fight will be chosen at random:
      • Code B: Easy
      • Code A: Normal
      • Code S: Hard

    • You can set a total of 20 challenges you would like to take on, and when you have selected how many challenges you want, the challenges will be chosen at random. The following challenges are available for you to take on:

    • You have a total of 20 lives shared across all 6 bosses per week. If you use up all 20, you’re done for the week!
      • Utilize Practice Mode to scout out fights, and speak with Althea to adjust the difficulty level and number of challenges as needed.
    • The difficulty and number of challenges determine the base when defeating the 6 bosses, and the number of remaining lives affects the final score.
    • The Dark Ride: Ride or Die event resets Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC

    Kazax's Interference

    • Kazax will appear alongside the boss and disrupt your fight by using skills that interfere with your fight by randomly using one of his skills at regular intervals.

    Althea's Support

    • Althea is here to support you during the fights! Upon entering the boss map, you will receive the Althea’s Support skill, which can be charged up to Lv. 3 with support.
      • The higher the skill level is charged, the more powerful the effect will be!

    • The amount of support required to charge each level of the skill gauge is 150.
      • The skill gauge fills by 1 slot for every 15 support received.
      • Receive a small amount of support at regular intervals.
      • Receive a great amount of support when touching the summoned object.
        • The object spawns at a random location every 30 seconds and disappears after a certain duration.

    • Once the gauge is full, activate the skill by using the interact key. This will remove summoned enemies and some of the disruptions caused by Kazax.

    Weekly Score Rewards

    • Each week, your final score will determine which Inspector's Supply Box and how many Kazax's Energy Fragments you'll receive.

    • You can obtain the following special items at a set probability when using Kazax Energy Fragments:
    Obtainable Items from Kazax’s Energy Fragment
    Item Tradability/Duration
    Chains of Resentment Coupon (Interactive only)
    Use to receive:
    • Chains of Resentment: Untradable, 30-day duration.

    Note: Equip the Chains of Resentment and use the skill it grants to increase the number and frequency of enemy spawns on a map. (The effect disappears upon changing maps.) If there are 1 or more Chains of Resentment on the map, a new Chains of Resentment cannot be summoned.

    		 Tradable within account, 90-day duration.
    Inkwell Coin (Heroic only)
    Use to receive:
    • 200,000,000 Mesos: Untradable, Permanent.
    		 Tradable within account, 90-day duration.
    Silver Inspector Coin x10 Coupon Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Silver Inspector Coin x50 Coupon Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Silver Inspector Coin x100 Coupon Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Gold Inspector Coin Coupon Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Spell Trace x50 Coupon Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Inspector's Meso Pouch (Interactive only) Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Extreme Growth Potion Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Magnificent Growth Potion
    Hyper Burning characters can use this potion.    		 Tradable within account, 7-day duration.

    Mystical Cube Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Mysterious Mineral Pouch Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    [Updated 11/19/2024] Mysterious Herb Pouch
    Increases Drop rate by 50% for 5 minutes.    		 Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Item Drop Rate Increase Potion (Heroic only)
    Increases Drop rate by 200% for 5 minutes.    		 Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    Mapae Nodestone
    Use to receive one of the following:
    • Luck Power: Increases Item Drop Rate by 20%
    • Wealth Power: Increases Meso Drop by 20%
    • EXP Power: Increases EXP gained by 10%
    • Inspector Power I: Increases Boss Damage by 40%
    • Inspector Power II: Increases Ignore Defense by 40%

    Note: Special nodes are available for use for a period of 7 days. They activate 30 seconds after being equipped and remain active for 20 seconds. The duration of the Mapae Nodestone cannot be extended.

    		 Tradable within account, 10-day duration.
    Althea Transformation Potion Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    VIP Booster Box
    Use to receive:
    • VIP Booster (x10): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    		 Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • There are six levels of supply boxes. Score higher to receive higher-level boxes. The types and quantities of items contained are based on box level.
      • You can only redeem 1 box a week per account.
    Inspector Supply Boxes Obtained by Score

    Participation Rewards

    • Participate each week to earn rewards! Even if you don't defeat a boss, you'll still receive the participation reward.
    Participation Rewards
    Participation Reward
    2 Weeks Ride or Die System Skin Coupon: Tradable within world, expires February 11 at 11:59 PM UTC. Use coupon to receive:
    • Ride or Die System Skin: Untradable Permanent.

    • Ride or Die Mysterious Cave Background: Shared within account, Permanent.

    • Ride or Die Kazax's Altar Background: Shared within account, Permanent.
    10 Weeks Inspector Weapon Coupon: Tradable within world, 10-day duration. Use coupon to receive:
    • Inspector Weapon: Untradable, Permanent.

     

    Ride or Die Legion Block: Untradable, Permanent.

    • Note: to receive the Ride or Die Legion Block, you must participate in at least 10 weeks AND defeat 3 bosses.

    [Updated 11/19/2024] While characters in Burning World can participate in The Dark Ride: Ride or Die, please note that the event Legion Block CANNOT be transferred during the Burning World Leap event.

    Coin Shop

    • Defeat bosses to earn various consumable items as well as Silver, Bronze, and Gold Inspector Coins.
      • The harder the difficulty and the more challenges you complete, the more coins you’ll earn!
    • Exchange Bronze, Silver, and Gold Inspector Coins in the Ride or Die Shop for items that will help with your character's growth and exclusive Ride Or Die event items!

    PAGE OF MEMORIES EVENTS

     

    Page of Memories

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    Librarian Thales invites you to meet him behind the Grand Athenaeum! Become a History Guide and delve into the forgotten Festival Memories.

    • Accept the ‘[Festival Memories] History Guide’s Path’ quest within the star event notifier on the left side of the screen.
    • Upon accepting the quest, you will get teleported to the event map to meet Librarian Thales himself!
    • Accept the ‘[Book of Forgotten Festivals] Festivals in Memories’ quest and help Librarian Thales restore the records of festivals long past.

    Back to Top

    Book of Unforgettable Festivals

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who have completed the ‘[Festival Memories] History Guide’s Path’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2) .

    • Accept the ‘[Festival Memories] Thale’s Call’ quest by talking to Librarian Thales located in History’s Origin.
      • You can also accept the quest by clicking “Thale’s Call” then “Participate” within the star event notifier on the left side of the screen.
    • Enter the portals located at the five books and experience the stories of the following Commanders past:
      • Von Leon
      • Will
      • Hilla
      • Curious Spirit and Gruff Spirit
      • Arkarium
    • Note: Speak to Rita if you wish to leave a story, and your progress will automatically be saved.

    • Upon completing all Commander’s stories, you can start the epilogue story.
    • Complete the ‘[Festival Memories] Thales’s Call’ quest by talking to Librarian Thales and claim your reward.

    Rewards:

    • Book of Unforgettable Festivals Chair: Tradable within account, permanent.

    Back to Top

    Book of Forgotten Festivals

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who have completed the ‘[Festival Memories] History Guide’s Path’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2) .

    • Accept the ‘[Book of Forgotten Festival] Forgotten Festival from Memory’ quest by talking to Librarian Thales located at History’s Origin.
    • Upon accepting the quest, click the “Book of Forgotten Festivals” button in the event notifier to view your event progress.
    • The Book of Forgotten Festivals Basic Research and Advanced Research progress is shared among all characters within the same account.

    Basic Research

    • Log in once a day and click the “Research Complete” button in the Book of Forgotten Festivals to receive the following rewards in addition to that day’s Basic Research reward:
      • 3x EXP Coupon (x3): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
        • The last day to claim the coupons is January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC.
      • Lavender Candle (x5): Tradable within account, usable until January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC.
      • Jasmine Candle (x5): Tradable within account, usable until January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC.
    • Lavender Candle and Jasmine Candle can be used in the [Azwan Shamaness’ Blessing] event.
    • Basic Research can only be completed up to 5 times per week and a maximum of 35 times during the event.
    • For 3,000 Maple Points, use the Basic Research Pass to complete 1 Basic Research that was previously missed. It can only be used up to the number of available uses.
      • Missed days do not accumulate daily at reset. Instead they will be available for purchase after reset on Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
    • Basic Research Rewards can be claimed only once per account.

    Basic Research Check-in Rewards:

    • Day 1: Prepared Pendant of the Spirit (30 Day) Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Prepared Pendant of the Spirit (30 Day): Tradable within account, 30-day duration.
    • Day 2: Permanent Bottled Memories Mount Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Permanent Bottled Memories Mount: Tradable within account, Permanent.
    • Day 3: Special Medal of Honor (x50): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 4: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 5: Magnificent Growth Potion (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use on a character between Lv. 200 and Lv. 249 to gain 1 level. Characters Lv. 250 or above will obtain a considerable amount of EXP. Characters with Burning effects cannot use the item.
    • Day 6: Experience Nodestone (x10): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 7: Book of Forgotten Festivals Effect Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Book of Forgotten Festivals Effect: Tradable within account, Permanent.
    • Day 8: Karma Black Rebirth Flame (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 9: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 10: Sol Erda (x2): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 11: Nodestone (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 12: Magic of Memories Action Damage Skin (Unit) Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Magic of Memories Action Damage Skin (Unit): Tradable within account, Permanent.
    • Day 13: Special Medal of Honor (x50): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 14: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 15: Magnificent Growth Potion (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use on a character between Lv. 200 and Lv. 249 to gain 1 level. Characters Lv. 250 or above will obtain a considerable amount of EXP. Characters with Burning effects cannot use the item.
    • Day 16: Experience Nodestone (x10): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 17: Chair of Forgotten Festivals Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Chair of Forgotten Festivals: Tradable within account, Permanent.
    • Day 18: Karma Black Rebirth Flame (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 19: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 20: Sol Erda (x2): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 21: Nodestone (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 22: Record Skylark Set Selector Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Use to choose one hat and one outfit:
        • Red Record Skylark Hat
        • Blue Record Skylark Hat
        • Record Skylark Suit Outfit (M)
        • Record Skylark Dress (F)
      • You will also receive all of the following:
        • Record Skylark Shoes
        • Record Skylark Wings
        • Skylark’s Record

    • Day 23: Special Medal of Honor (x50): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 24: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 25: Karma Star Force 17-Star Enhancement (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 26: Experience Nodestone (x10): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 27: Page of Memories Background Coupon: Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Page of Memories Background: Account bound, Permanent.

    • Day 28: Karma Black Rebirth Flame (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 29: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 30: Fairy Heart Coupon (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Fairy Heart (x1): UnTradable, Permanent.
    • Day 31: Nodestone (x100): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 32: Commander Android Selector Coupon (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use the coupon to choose one of the following Commander androids:
      • Von Leonroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
      • Arkariumroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
      • Shamaness Hillaroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
      • Child Willroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
      • Bunny Orchiroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
      • Bunny Lotusroid:
        • Heroic Worlds: UnTradable, Permanent.
        • Interactive Worlds: Tradable within account, Permanent.
    • Day 33: Karma Solid Cube (x30): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 34: Symbol Selector Coupon (300/60): Tradable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Day 35: Transcendent Growth Potion (x1): Tradable within account, 7-day duration. Use on a character between Lv. 200 and Lv. 269 to gain 1 level. Characters Lv. 270 or above will obtain a considerable amount of EXP. Characters with Burning effects cannot use the item.

    Advanced Research

    • Defeat 2,000 enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) and click the ‘Claim’ button to get Festival Record (x1,500).
    • Festival Records can be used at the Festival Record Training Center.
    • Secret Records can be used at the Secret Record Training Center.
      • Obtain Secret Records by participating in the ‘[Page of Memories] Preserving Secret Records’ event.
    • Festival Records and Secret Records are shared between your characters within the same world.
    • Advanced research can be completed up to 3 times a week and a maximum of 21 times during the event.
    • For 3,000 Maple Points, use the Advanced Research Pass to complete 1 Advanced Research that was previously missed. It can only be used up to the number of available uses.
      • Missed days do not accumulate daily at reset. Instead they will be available for purchase after reset on Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.
    • Advanced Research Rewards can be claimed only once per account.
    • Advanced research availability resets every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.

    Back to Top

    Azwan Shamaness Blessing

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who have completed the ‘[Book of Forgotten Festival] Forgotten Festival from Memory ’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    • Accept the ‘[Azwan Shamaness’ Blessing] Check’ quest by talking to Hilla located in History’s Origin.
    • Upon accepting the quest, click the ‘Azwan Shamaness Blessing’ in the event notifier to view your event progress.
    • Use the Jasmine Candles and Lavender Candles earned from completing Basic Research in the Book of Forgotten Festivals to enhance your stats with Hilla’s Blessing and Medina’s Blessing.
      • All characters within the world share both Jasmine Candle and Lavender Candle when obtained.
      • All characters within the world who have completed ‘[Azwan Shamaness’ Blessing] Check’’ will share these leveled-up skill stats.
      • Once a week per account, you can purchase 10 Jasmine Candles and 10 Lavender Candles for 9,900 Maple Points each.
    Hilla's Blessing Skill Stats Per Level
    Stats Lv. 1 Lv. 2 Lv. 3 Lv. 4 Lv. 5 Lv. 6
    Attack Power & Magic ATT +5 +10 +15 +20 +25 +30

    Max HP/MP +500 +1000 +1500 +2000 +2500 +3000

    Back to Top

    Von Leon’s Swordsmanship

    November 20 (after maintenance) - December 16 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who have completed the ‘[Book of Forgotten Festival] Forgotten Festival from Memory ’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    • Accept the ‘[Von Leon’s Swordsmanship] New Knight Recruitment’ quest by talking to Von Leon located at History’s Origin.
      • You can also select the ‘Von Leon’s Swordsmanship’ button from the event list and click the ‘Participate’ button to accept the quest.
    • Upon completing the quest, you will receive the ‘Knightly Training’ skill in the Beginner tab of your skill UI.
      • Knightly Training will activate automatically when you enter a hunting map with enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).
      • You can toggle this skill on and off by right-clicking on the skill.

    • The ‘Knightly Training’ skill lets you receive a large amount of EXP and Von Leon attacks nearby enemies when the gauge is completely filled.
      • The gauge fills up every time you defeat 300 enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above).
      • You can activate this skill 30 times per character.

    Back to Top

    Preserving Secret Records

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 200 and above characters who have completed the 5th Job Advancement and the ‘[Book of Forgotten Festival] Forgotten Festival from Memory ’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    • Accept the ‘[Secret Record Reclamation] Will’s Suggestion’ quest by talking to Will located at History’s Origin.
      • You can also select the ‘Preserving Secret Records’ button from the event list and click the ‘Participate’ button to accept the quest.
    • Move to the ‘Preserving Secret Records Entrance’ preparation area by talking to Will again. You’ll have 2 minutes to buff up.
      • All buff effects will be removed upon entry. However, buff effects will remain when entering from the exit map if you want to challenge Memory Devourers again.

    Note: There is an entry requirement to complete one Advanced Research each week to participate in the Preserving Secret Records event. Once you complete a total of 21 Advanced Researches, the entry requirement will be removed, and you can participate without completing an Advanced Research.

    • When ready, talk to Will again to move to the ‘Preserving Secret Records’ map to attack Memory Devourers and deal as much damage as you can to earn points within 2 minutes.
      • There are a total of 7 stages, with HP and defense increasing as you progress through the stages.
      • You can earn up to 2,050 points.
      • If you exit during the battle, your points will reset.

    • You’ll automatically be moved to the exit map once either time is up or you reach 2,050 points.
    • Talk to Will to receive EXP, Secret Records, and Extra Secret Records based on your score.
      • EXP can only be claimed once a week for characters Lv. 200 and above.
        • The EXP you claim will scale proportionally to your level.
      • Secret Records and Extra Secret Records can only be claimed once a week.
        • From 1- 2000 points, you will earn 1 Secret Records for every point.
        • From 2,001 - 2,050 points, you will earn 1 Extra Secret Records for every point.

    Note: If the same character challenges again within the week and scores higher points, you can obtain additional EXP and Secret Records reward, which is the difference from the previous record.

    • EXP rewards, Secret Records rewards, Extra Secret Records rewards and best record reset every Wednesday at 12:00 AM UTC.

    Back to Top

    Secret Record Training Center

    November 20 (after maintenance) - January 19 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirement: Lv. 101 and above characters who have completed the ‘[Preserving Secret Records] Complete Will’s Suggestion ’ quest (Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2).

    • Access the Secret Record Training Center by opening the Book of Forgotten Festivals UI and clicking the ‘Open Shop’ button.
      • You can also access the shop by talking to Stack of Magic Books located in History’s Origin.
    • Use Secret Records and Extra Secret Records to purchase items in the shop.
      • Secret Records and Extra Secret Records are shared between your characters within the same world.
      • Secret Records and Extra Secret Records can be obtained until January 14 at 11:59 PM UTC.
    • Secret Record Training Center Shop will be open until January 19 at 11:59 PM UTC.

    • Cleared the Book of Forgotten Festivals quest? It’s time to hit up the Meso Shop from Skylark Romi for some real goodies!
    • Note: If your scroll bag has available spaces, any scroll items purchased from the meso shop will be directly placed into the scroll bag.

    BURNING EVENTS

    Item Burning

    November 20th 2:00 PM UTC - February 11th 11:59 PM UTC

    Hyper Burning characters are about to get even more support to get caught up into the action with the all new Item Burning system!

    Requirements: Lv. 200 newly created Hyper Burning character and have completed the ‘A Greater Power’ quest. (Newly created Hyper Burning Zero character that has completed Story Quest Act 2).

    • Click on the Event Notifier or talk to the Administrator NPC located at the Event Hall and click the ‘Participate’ button.
    • Starting with the new Hyperburning Aran or Shade from the Blooming Moon event? You can apply the Item Burning to these characters for an even smoother leveling experience!
    • After completing the ‘[Item Burning] Leveling Equipment - A necessity for Challengers’ quest you will receive 8 types of Challenger Equipment for your Job in your inventory.
    • Equipment consists of the following:
      • Challenger Weapon, Hat, Top, Bottom, Gloves, Shoes, Cape, and Shoulder Accessory.
        • Xenon characters receive a regular weapon instead of a Thief or Pirate exclusive weapon.
        • Zero characters receive 7 equipment pieces and do not receive a weapon.
        • Stats for each equipment are predetermined and are based on your character’s Job. Please note that restrictions apply for Scroll use, Star Force enhancement, Transfer Hammer, Bonus Stats resetting, and Potential resetting.
    • Challenger Equipment will be enhanced by completing the following missions:
    Stage Level Content Reward
    1 200 Defeat Zakum [Chaos] by yourself Challenger Equipment Perk 1
    2 210 Defeat Vellum [Chaos] by yourself Challenger Equipment Perk 2
    3 220 Defeat Papulatus [Chaos] by yourself Challenger Equipment Perk 3
    4 225 Defeat Lotus [Normal] by yourself Challenger Equipment Perk 4
    5 230 Defeat Guardian Angel Slime [Normal] by yourself Challenger Equipment Perk 5
      • Missions are completed if you defeat the boss on a higher difficulty by yourself.
    • A final Challenger’s Mission will be available when reaching Lv. 260, providing you with a special reward!
      • Challenger’s Mission: Defeat Lucid [Easy] by yourself.
        • Reward:
          • 100 Sol Erda Fragments, Untradable, Permanent.
          • Level 5 Sacred Symbol: Cernium, Untradable, Permanent.
    • You MUST clear the previous stage’s mission in order to be able to complete the next mission.
    • Item Burning event can only be completed PER ACCOUNT.
      • If you create a new character after deleting the character, you are unable to participate in the event again.
    • Equipment will be given after completion of the ‘[Item Burning] Leveling Equipment - A Necessity for Challengers’ quest, so make sure to complete the quest on the character you want the equipment on.
    • Characters who have completed the 6th Job Advancement are able to use the Sol Erda Fragments.
    • The Lv. 5 Sacred Symbol: Cernium can be claimed after completing the ‘A Divine Power’ quest.
    • If Open Advancement is performed, the relevant Job’s weapon will be distributed for replacement upon completion of the next mission after Open Advancement.
    • Fusion Anvil, Soul Collector, Soul, and Item Tag items are able to be used on Challenger equipment but will be reset when equipment growth is performed.

    Back to Top

    Zero to One Hundred

    Thinking about playing jobs other than your main or starting on some boss mules? Now's the time! Level up quickly and boost your Legion rank - it's faster than ever!

    November 20th 2:00 PM UTC - January 14th 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirements: Characters between Lv. 10 - Lv. 100. Zero characters cannot participate in the event. Burning characters can also participate.

    • Boost to Lv. 100 with 7 characters in no time with the return of Zero to One Hundred!
    • Accept the '[Zero to One Hundred] Accelerated Zero to One Hundred’ quest through the star event notifier on the left side of the screen or talk to Spiegelette located in Henesys, Nameless Town, and Cernium.
      • There will be a special Zero to One Hundred growth effect displayed on the character you designated in the character selection screen.
    • Characters designated for Zero to One Hundred can move to the hunting zone through the '[Zero to One Hundred] Move to the Leveling Acceleration Hunting Zone' quest in the star event notifier or by talking to Spiegelette.
    • In the hunting zone, you’ll defeat monsters that give accelerated EXP.
    • You can freely enter or exit the level acceleration hunting zone by talking to Spiegelette at any time during the event.
    • There will be different hunting zones depending on your level that you will automatically move to upon entering.
    • After reaching the level for the next hunting zone, you can move there by talking to Spiegelette within the current hunting zone.
    • After you reach Lv. 101, you will be automatically moved to the map you were in prior to entering the hunting zone.
    • Up to 7 characters per account can participate in the event.
      • The count is deducted after setting the character for Zero to One Hundred.
      • The count isn't restored even if the set character is deleted, and an additional selection can't be made that day.
      • You can only set one character a day.
    • Certain jobs must complete their early tutorials to move to the Zero to One Hundred level-accelerated hunting zone.
      • Cadena, Ark, and Illium cannot acquire EXP in level-accelerated hunting zones if they haven't completed their early tutorials.
    • Keep note that you cannot form parties with other characters within the hunting zone.
    • The Atmospheric Effect that is used in the hunting zone is applied.
    • EXP obtained from monsters in the hunting zone will have the EXP Boost buff effect applied.
    • Characters will have their own monsters summoned in the hunting zone and will not share monsters with other players.
    • You can still claim Level Achievement Rewards and special gifts even when reaching set levels outside the level-accelerated hunting zone.

    Level Achievement Rewards:

    • Reach Lv. 30: Lv. 30 Equipment Box: UnTradable, 30-day duration. Open to receive an unTradable weapon and armor set suitable for your class.
    • Reach Lv. 60: Lv. 60 Equipment Box: UnTradable, 30-day duration. Open to receive an unTradable weapon and armor set suitable for your class.
    • Reach Lv. 101: Legendary Cryptic Chest: UnTradable, 30-day duration. Item can be opened with a Lv. 100 and above character. Open to receive:
      • Frozen Hat: UnTradable, Permanent. Req. Lv: 100. STR/DEX/INT/LUK +23, MaxHP/MaxMP +270, Attack Power/Magic ATT +1, Defense +293. Upgrades available: 10.
      • Frozen Cape: UnTradable, Permanent. Req. Lv: 100. STR/DEX/INT/L
      • UK +7, Attack Power/Magic ATT +7, Defense +180, Speed +9, Jump +5. Upgrades available: 7.
      • Frozen Suit: UnTradable, Permanent. Req. Lv: 100. STR/DEX/INT/LUK +27, Attack Power/Magic ATT +1, Defense +315. Upgrades available: 10.
      • Frozen Weapon Box: UnTradable, 7-day duration. Open to receive:
        • Frozen Weapon: UnTradable, Permanent. Req. Lv: 100. Stats will vary based upon your job.
      • Frozen Secondary Weapon Box: UnTradable, 7-day duration. Open to receive:
        • Frozen Secondary Weapon: UnTradable, Permanent. Req. Lv: 100. Stats will vary based upon your job.

    Accelerated Zero to One Hundred Special Gift:

    • The special gift can be claimed from a world where the Zero to 100 level acceleration character didn't level up upon meeting the special gift claiming requirement.
    • Only obtainable once per account.
    • My Friend Orange Mushroom Hat: UnTradable, Permanent.

    • Our Maple Tree Chair: Transferable within account, Permanent. Other players can sit on the chair with you!

    Back to Top

    Hyper Burning

    November 20 (after maintenance) - February 11 at 11:59 PM UTC

    Requirements: Characters that meet one of the below criteria.

    1. Characters who were newly created during the event period
    2. Existing Lv. 200 - 258 character (For Zero character, one must be Lv. 200 - 258 and must have completed Story Quest Act 2)
    • Designate one character as your Hyper Burning character and they’ll gain 2 additional levels for each level up from Lv. 11 to Lv. 260!
    • Check the ‘[Hyper Burning] Unlimited Growth! Hyper Burning!’ quest through the star event notifier.
    • One Hyper Burning character and One Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning can be created per account during the event.
    • Hyper Burning character can be designated when creating a new character or from an existing Lv. 200 - 258 character.
      • When an existing character is set as Hyper Burning, the Level-Up Support rewards can be claimed. However, the level achievement rewards for levels already reached cannot be claimed.
    • Hyper Burning characters can gain 2 additional levels for each level up starting from Lv. 11 until 260.
      • Note: only Typhoon Growth Potion, Magnificent Growth Potion, and Transcendent Growth Potion obtained from events that start after the maintenance can be used on Hyper Burning and Blossoming by Moonshade: Hyper Burning characters.
    • A new character created during the Hyper Burning event can either be Mega Burning (created in Burning World), Hyper Burning, or regular character.
      • All the types of Burning character that can be set in Burning World are displayed and you can press the [Set as Hyper Burning] button to create
      • Other worlds will show a selection window asking if you will set as Hyper Burning.
      • Clicking the [Cancel] or [No] buttons will create a regular character.
    • A flame effect will appear behind the character in the character selection window when set as Hyper Burning character. (Please note that it cannot be canceled after designating as a Hyper Burning character)
    • Reaching certain levels will grant you special rewards to help you progress.
      • Hyper Burning characters can claim rewards through Hyper Burning UI whenever they meet certain conditions.
        • Press the ‘Claim’ button at the bottom of the UI to get the reward.
        • You can get an even more enhanced level achievement reward in Burning World.
      • Level achievement rewards can be claimed once per account. You cannot claim it again even if you delete the character after claiming and create a new one.
      • Only characters who completed the 5th Job Advancement and the ‘A Greater Power’ quest can claim the Eternal Flame Title Coupon, Nodestone, and Infinite Flame Title Coupon rewards.
      • For an existing character that already has the Eternal Flame Ring, another one cannot be obtained from the Eternal Flame Ring Coupon.
      • ou cannot receive the Burning world reward and Interactive world reward under the same achievement conditions at the same time.
    • You can only obtain the symbol of the region you've completed the Arcane River and Grandis story quests, when you use the Arcane/Sacred Symbol Selector Coupon.
    • Each region's Arcane Symbol reward can be claimed after completing the relevant region's Arcane Symbol quest.
    • If the Arcane Symbol was transferred by using Arcane Catalyst, the Unstable Arcane Symbol must be normalized first and then claim the level achievement reward (Lv. 5/Lv. 7 Arcane Symbol) to enhance it properly.
    • Existing Lv. 200 - 258 characters or existing Lv. 200 - 258 Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2 can be set as a Hyper Burning character by pressing the [Set as Hyper Burning] button on the right of the character selection window.
      • If you create the Zero character as Hyper Burning, you will not receive the 1+2 level up benefit until Lv. 100 - 199.
      • You cannot claim the event reward if you created Zero character as the Hyper Burning character, until you have completed the Story Quest Act 2.
      • In the case of existing Lv. 200 - 258 Zero characters, Story Quest Act 2 must be completed to set the character as the Hyper Burning character.
      • Zero characters can claim the Level-Up Support rewards and level achievement rewards after they have completed Story Quest Act 2.
      • Zero characters cannot use the AbsoLab weapon, so they can only claim the Dominator Pendant from the selection of rewards when they reach Lv. 220.
    Hyper Burning Rewards
    Achievement Required Interactive and Heroic Rewards Burning World Rewards

      • Snail Pet: Untradable, 30-day duration.

      • Frozen Suit: Untradable, Permanent.

      • Frozen Weapon: Untradable, Permanent.

      • Eagle Eye Top: Untradable, 90-day duration.

    Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning

    November 20 (after maintenance) - February 11 at 11:59 PM UTC

    • Create a new Aran or Shade character and designate it as a ‘Blossoming by Moonshade: Hyper Burning’ character.
      • If you do not have a character designated as a Hyper Burning yet, when creating an Aran or Shade, the Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning will be applied first.
    • Existing Lv. 200 - 258 Aran/Shade characters can be set as Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning by pressing the ‘Set as Hyper Burning’ button the the right side of the character selection window.

    • Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning characters can earn two additional levels each time you gain a level up from Lv. 11 to Lv. 260!
      • Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning characters can only use Typhoon Growth Potions, Magnificent Growth Potions, and Transcendent Growth Potions.
    • Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning characters can unlock and claim rewards through the ‘Blossoming by Moonshade: Hyper Burning’ button in the star event notifier on the left side of the screen.
      • Characters leveling in Burning World can receive even more powerful Burning World rewards.
      • Level achievement rewards can be claimed once per account. You cannot claim it again even if you delete the character after claiming and create a new one.
      • Only characters who completed the 5th Job Advancement and the ‘A Greater Power’ quest can claim the Eternal Flame Title Coupon, Nodestone, and Infinite Flame Title Coupon rewards.
      • For an existing character that already has the Eternal Flame Ring, another of the same item cannot be obtained from the Eternal Flame Ring Coupon.
      • You cannot receive the Burning world reward and Interactive world reward under the same achievement conditions at the same time.
      • You can only obtain the symbol of the region you've completed the Arcane River and Grandis story quests, when you use the Arcane/Sacred Symbol Selector Coupon.
      • Each region's Arcane Symbol reward can be claimed after completing the relevant region's Arcane Symbol quest.
      • If the Arcane Symbol was transferred by using Arcane Catalyst, the Unstable Arcane Symbol must be normalized first and then claim the level achievement reward (Lv. 5/Lv. 8 Arcane Symbol) to enhance it properly.
    • Both newly created and existing characters designated as Hyper Burning can claim the character creation reward.
      • The character creation reward can be claimed again if the Hyper Burning character is deleted and a new one is created.
    • Blossoming by Moonshade Hyper Burning characters will receive the same rewards listed in the Hyper Burning section.

    Back to Top

    Blossoming by Moonshade: Flower Scroll - Aran

    November 20 (after maintenance) - February 11 at 11:59 PM UTC

    We prepared gifts for both new and existing Aran characters!

    • Accept the ‘[Blossoming by Moonshade Scroll] Leveling Gifts’ by talking to Cassandra or click on the ‘[Blossoming by Moonshade Scroll] Leveling Gifts’ button and click on the ‘Participate’ button within the star event notifier on the left side of the screen.’
      • You can check the progress of the event by clicking the ‘Blossoming by Moonshade: Moon Scroll” button on the event list.

    Gifts for New Aran Characters

    • Receive rewards that support your Aran’s growth when you reach certain levels.
      • Rewards can be claimed once per account.
    Rewards for New Aran Characters

    Note: The Blossoming by Moonshade Title Coupon can only be claimed once per account.

    Gifts for All Aran Characters

    • Defeat 1,000 enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) and click the ‘Check In’ button to receive the event reward.
      • You can check in daily once per account.
      • Reward details are shared among all characters within the world.
      • Check-ins and the number of defeated enemies are not shared between Aran and Shade jobs.
      • Titles awarded from Gifts for All Aran Characters do not include stats.
    Check-In Rewards for All Aran Characters
    Check-In Days Reward
    Day 1
    • Lil Maha Pet Package (x1): Tradable within world, 7-day duration. Open to receive:
      • Lil Maha: Untradable, 90-day duration. Period can be extended with the Water of Life
      • Lil Maha’s Polearm: Untradable, Permanent.

    • Through Trial Flowers Bloom Title Coupon (x1): Untradable, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Through Trial Flowers Boom Title: Untradable, Permanent.

      • New Aran Hero Feather: Untradable, Permanent.

      • Permanent Ice Blossom Mount: Untradable, Permanent.
    Day 5

    Day 6
    • Aran Damage Skin (Unit) Coupon: Tradable within world, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
      • Aran Damage Skin (Unit): Untradable, Permanent.

    Note: When applying a new damage skin without saving your existing damage skin, the current damage skin equipped will be permanently removed.
    Day 7

      • Aran Label Ring: Untradable, Permanent.
      • Aran Chat Ring: Untradable, Permanent.

      • Rein Background: Shared within account, Permanent.
